Four Things

  1. One way to solve problems is to copy and paste the error message and search Google for suggestions.

  2.  It would still be a good idea to have printed step by step instructions.

  3.  We could use some practice in Notepad++

  4.  The explanations of why we use certain functions should be more clear.

Posted in: four-things ● Tagged:

Author: Mary Cargill

Mary Cargill began working at Columbia as a reference librarian in 1983, focusing on history and humanities. Previously, she was a reference librarian at SUNY Albany, and before that with the Library of Congress, where she specialized in performing arts research. She will be looking into the Leake and Watts Orphan Home, and especially the issue of homeless and orphan children in the 19th century. View all posts by Mary Cargill
